channel.title: Client wont start [PI]
channel.description:
I keep getting this error code when trying to start my PI client:
[code] Picked up _JAVA_OPTIONS: -Xmx1g Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Gui Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Gui at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: Gui. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
What can i do?

item.title: Client wont start [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Scarecrows Scarecrows
item.description:
@Scarecrows wrote:

Not sure what this ‘PI’ client is but it won’t execute because it can’t find your main class ‘Gui’. Modify whatever your using to launch it so that it can find your main class and start the program.

By guessing that you don’t have a class name ‘Gui’ change the launch configuration in your IDE to start using the ‘client’ class or if you’re using a batch file try this:

@echo off Start javaw -Xmx512m client pause

Read full topic

item.title: Client wont start [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Doobage Doobage
item.description:
@Doobage wrote:

I keep getting this error code when trying to start my PI client:

Picked up _JAVA_OPTIONS: -Xmx1g
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Gui
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Gui
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
Could not find the main class: Gui.  Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

What can i do?
